intro: Gomesa gutfreundiana, commonly known as the Gutfreund's gomesa, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
